other_tests.findings: Responded well at 1-4 mg/day for a decade; frequent blinking noted at age 39, exaggerated by stress and anxiety.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Blepharospasm was greatly relieved six months after discontinuing haloperidol, although mildly increased frequency of blinking continued.

other_tests.findings: Presented with excessive blinking and bilateral involuntary contractions of eyelids associated with spasms of facial muscles; difficulty keeping eyes open.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Frequency and intensity of blepharospasm decreased after resuming thioridazine.

other_tests.findings: Did not reveal any pathology in Ms. B.
Used during manic episodes for Ms. A.
Sought early in life for learning difficulties, multiple phobias and severe anxiety.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Progressed to frequent emergency room visits without relief for distressing anxiety symptoms.
